meanings.definition: To move troops or equipment into position for military action.
meanings.sent1: The general ordered the soldiers to deploy to the front lines.
meanings.sent2: The army will deploy additional forces to secure the area.
meanings.sent3: The troops were ready to deploy, but then they realized they forgot their helmets!
meanings.sent4: Like chess pieces on a board, the soldiers deploy across the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The image of the troops marching to deploy is etched in his memory.

meanings.sent1: The manager decided to deploy a new marketing strategy to boost sales.
meanings.sent2: The team will deploy their best players for the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The plan to deploy the new software was met with excitement by the employees.
meanings.sent4: With a swift motion, she deploy her umbrella to shield herself from the rain.
meanings.sent5: The superhero always knows the right time to deploy his powers for good.

meanings.sent1: The company will deploy its resources to maximize efficiency.
meanings.sent2: During the pandemic, it was crucial to deploy safety measures in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to deploy themselves around the library to find the best study spots.
meanings.sent4: Like a spider weaving its web, the team deploy their plan to capture the market.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons deploy across the sky, creating a beautiful sight.
